author: paulhauner
content: basically it's cheaper to check if `time < MIN_GENESIS_TIME` than to check `is_valid_genesis_state()`

author: nishant0
content:
but even then , you would need some way to cache the relevant parts of the state for 
`is_valid_genesis_state` otherwise you would re-process all the received deposits 
each time you get a new deposit and `time > MIN_GENESIS_TIME`

author: paulhauner
content: The ideal scenario (for minimal computation) is that the deposit contract fills up prior to `time == MIN_GENESIS_TIME`. In that case you only need to process the deposits once.
